text: nice. i recently made a fennel/carrot/lemon one that i was really excited about until i realized i oversalted and overfermented it. It was disgusting.
Over salt is tough...  I've got a good ratio that seems to be working for my size batches now, regardless of what the vegetables are.  1tbsp salt per 3lbs of veggies or per 1/2 gallon jar.
3lbs of veggies usually fills a half gallon jar.  If I switch to one gallon, I'm looking at 2tbsp of salt and roughly 6 lbs of veggies going in the jar.
